meta.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
meta.description: These cookies are soft and chewy on the inside, with a light crust on the outside.

steps.instructions: Melt 1/2 cup butter or margarine in a microwave-safe bowl.

steps.caption: make a batter
steps.instructions: Add 1/2 cup white sugar and 1/4 cup brown sugar, and stir until smooth.

steps.caption: add seasoning
steps.instructions: Add 1 tsp. vanilla and 1 egg, and stir until smooth.

steps.caption: cut cauliflower
steps.instructions: Add 1/2 cup of flour, 1/2 tsp. baking soda, and 1/4 tsp. salt, and stir until smooth.

steps.caption: batter the cauliflower
steps.instructions: Add the remaining 1 cup of flour, and mix until fully combined.

steps.caption: spread the cauliflower
steps.instructions: Add 3/4 cup chocolate chips, and mix in with your hands.

steps.caption: spread the cauliflower
steps.instructions: Roll the dough into golf-ball-sized pieces, and place 2-3 inches apart on a baking sheet.

steps.caption: bake
steps.instructions: Bake in a 350° F oven for 9-11 minutes

steps.caption: spread the cauliflower
steps.instructions: Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5-10 minutes before removing. To keep the cookies soft for longer, store them in an air-tight container.
